sentences: Ta on kaotanud oma mõistuse täielikult.
Lapsed said segaseks ja kaotasid ära kogu keskendumisvõime.
Pärast pikka ööd tööl oli ta täiesti kaotanud aru.
context: The word 'kaotanud' is the past participle form of the Estonian verb 'kaotama', which means 'to lose'. In this context, it refers to losing one's mental faculties or becoming confused and unable to think clearly. It can be used to describe someone who has lost their mind, become mentally disoriented, or whose thoughts have become muddled and unclear.
